newsitem.title: POLAND: IBCA to visit Poland next week, complete review.
newsitem.headline: IBCA to visit Poland next week, complete review.

text.p: An IBCA rating agency mission will visit Warsaw next week to finish work on an appraisal of the Polish economy, the finance ministry's foreign department head said on Thursday.
"IBCA will come next week and finish its work, the effect of which will then be processed by its rating committee," Wieslaw Szczuka told Reuters.
Asked whether Poland expected the review to result in an upgrade Szczuka said:
"We always expect a positive change in the long-term."

Szczuka said rating agencies Standard & Poor's and Moody's Investor Service had both finished appraisals of the Polish economy in April. But he would not comment on the likelihood of a rating upgrade from the two was likely.
Poland currently has a BBB rating from IBCA, Baa3 from Moody's and BBB-minus from Standard & Poor's.

This year's budget law allows Poland to issue $500 million worth of bonds and the finance ministry is mulling two issues on foreign markets, with the first planned for the turn of June and July, likely in the United States.
